ACT
123
When the inheritance of a person declared dead is opened and the start of the term
The day when the decision declaring the person dead became final is considered the day of opening of the inheritance of a person who has been declared dead, if no other day is specified as the day of death in the decision itself.
The deadlines that according to this Act start to run from the day of the opening of the inheritance start to run in the case of declaring a person dead only from the day when the decision about it became final.
